titleStmt.title: The ephemerides of Phialo deuided into three bookes. The first, a method which he ought to follow that desireth to rebuke his freend, when he seeth him swarue: without kindling his choler, or hurting himselfe. The second, a canuazado to courtiers in foure pointes. The third, the defence of a curtezan ouerthrowen. And a short apologie of the Schoole of abuse, against poets, pipers, players, [et] their excusers. By Steph. Gosson, stud. Oxon.
titleStmt.author: Gosson, Stephen, 1554-1624.

titleStmt.title: The ephemerides of Phialo deuided into three bookes. The first, a method which he ought to follow that desireth to rebuke his freend, when he seeth him swarue: without kindling his choler, or hurting himselfe. notesStmt.note: The first leaf is blank except for signature-mark "[pointing hand]".
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
